channel.title: How can you delete commands in Pi
channel.description: Hello, I am a new coder, first time actually. I downloaded a PI source and wished to get rid of the commands. I went to commands.java deleted them all, saved and compiled. Yet when I logged in in game, all the commands worked. I am using Hybridpvp v3. Any help is appreciated, thanks.

item.title: How can you delete commands in Pi
item.dc:creator: @rich_noob_xd rich noob xd
item.description:
@rich_noob_xd wrote:

Well, I know HBPVP is Pi, but I cannot add or take out. Even after I edit the source and compile. Do I also have to do something to the client side? If so what? I mean I made it do you have to type ::max instead of ::master just to see is it worked, it was a one word edit but even that did not compile and work. How ever I can change character files and things but I cannot add objects, or commands. This is what I need help with. Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: How can you delete commands in Pi

@rich_noob_xd wrote:

If anyone knows of a good server to start coding on, please let me know. Also what should I learn to start out coding, well to get a better understanding of it so I don’t have to leech.

item.title: How can you delete commands in Pi
item.dc:creator: @pkufast pkufast
item.description:
@pkufast wrote:

Sorry i did not see that you did use commands.java
But you should still follow this guide, as it should help. (remember your imports and statements may not look like mine)

Okay so you are going to not use notepad to edit your files because it can mess them up very bad if you dont know what your doing. I recommend since your a new coder, To get Eclipse. It’s the easiest java coding software to use if your new. It will also help you correct errors too. Also, your commands that are to be used in game, to delete them, You want to go in to commands.java, not just commands.text. The difference is commands.text logs the commands everyone uses so you can view that to ethier catch staff abuse or w\e. On the other hand commands.java or other words, commands.class. Is used to create commands for players, and staff, (donators also). So your going to want to get eclipse, open commands.java(not .class) and do not delete everything because you will get errors, a pro coder will just do this, at the very first command, you will see something like this
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“report”) && playerCommand.length() > 7) { (example)

In front of the if statment you will put this /*, which voids out anything until you scroll down and put this /.
Make sure you put that / before the if statment, of your very first command in the command.java, and then scroll all the way down until you see the last command, and right after the last command you will see this,
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”)) {
for (int i = 0; i < 22; i++) {
c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

}
^ you will see that bracket,  and just do this like so }*/

then all your commands will be voided, however, you will need to compile, if you wish to make all new commands, then just delete all the if statments, but do not delete these staments and imports. Or you will have no clue how to make a new commands.java file. Hope this helps! =]

package server.model.players.packets;

import server.Config;
import server.Connection;
import server.Server;
import server.model.players.PlayerSave;
import server.model.players.Player;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;
import server.model.players.PlayerHandler;
import server.util.Misc;

import java.io.*;

/**

  • Commands
    **/
    public class Commands implements PacketType
    {

    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize)
    {
    String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
    if (!playerCommand.startsWith("/"))
    {
    c.getPA().writeCommandLog(playerCommand);
    }

Read full topic

item.title: How can you delete commands in Pi
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

ranger squad:

Why shouldn’t he?

Because im assuming he deleted the public void playerCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)

And he won’t know how to put it back in since he stated he was a new coder. Without any writing in the commands.java (if the notepad is still there) it will still have the commands that were there before. You have to delete the notepad ( ithink, i’ve never deleted all my commands lmfao)

Read full topic
